metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7382 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
For the NVIDIA Quadro, NVS, GeForce, and Tesla products, NVIDIA GPU Display Driver contains a vulnerability in the kernel mode layer (nvlddmkm.sys for Windows or nvidia.ko for Linux) handler where a missing permissions check may allow users to gain access to arbitrary physical memory, leading to an escalation of privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7382` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libcuda1-304 - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
libcuda1-304-updates - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-304 - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-304-updates - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-current - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-libopencl1-304 - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-libopencl1-304-updates - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-opencl-icd-304 - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
nvidia-opencl-icd-304-updates - 304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: nvidia-graphics-drivers-304 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '304.132-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
nvidia-graphics-drivers-340 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '340.98-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').

nvidia-graphics-drivers-352 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '367.57-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').

nvidia-graphics-drivers-361 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '367.57-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
